DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure T-Lymphocyte CD4 Antigen Evaluation Outcome Integer::0 Decimal Place Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 0 decimal place numeric laboratory value measured, assigned or computed related to the assessment of CD4 antigen in a specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure T-Lymphocyte CD4 Antigen Evaluation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the evaluation of  CD4 Antigen, encoded by the CD4 gene, is a T-cell surface glycoprotein. CD4 has a role in cell-cell interactions and may act in signal transduction. CD4 is a accessory protein for MHC class-II antigen/T-cell receptor interaction and functions to initiate or augment the early phase of T-cell activation. CD4 enhances T-cell sensitivity to antigen and binds to LCK, which phosphorylates CD3-zeta. CD4 Antigen also serves as an HIV receptor, binding directly to the envelope protein gp120 on HIV. (From LocusLink, OMIM and NCI)

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: A type of immune cell that can attack foreign cells, cancer cells, and cells infected with a virus. T lymphocytes can also help control immune responses. A T lymphocyte is a type of white blood cell.:CD4 Antigen, encoded by the CD4 gene, is a T-cell surface glycoprotein. CD4 has a role in cell-cell interactions and may act in signal transduction. CD4 is a accessory protein for MHC class-II antigen/T-cell receptor interaction and functions to initiate or augment the early phase of T-cell activation. CD4 enhances T-cell sensitivity to antigen and binds to LCK, which phosphorylates CD3-zeta. CD4 Antigen also serves as an HIV receptor, binding directly to the envelope protein gp120 on HIV. (From LocusLink, OMIM and NCI):Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

Concepts.definition: A thymocyte-derived lymphocyte of immunological importance that is long-lived (months to years) and is responsible for cell-mediated immunity. T lymphocyte cells form rosettes with sheep erythrocytes and, in the presence of transforming agents (mitogens), differentiate and divide. These cells have the characteristic T3 surface marker and may be further divided into subsets according to function, such as helper, cytotoxic, etc.
T-cell surface glycoprotein CD4 (458 aa, ~51 kDa) is encoded by the human CD4 gene. This protein plays a role in antigen recognition and HIV entry.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
